issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Need to run 'make translations' to update the console's i18n files after fixing the invalid XHTML in the following files:
- templates/cloudwatch/alarm_actions.pt (line 17)
- templates/cloudwatch/alarms_detail.pt (line 30)
- templates/cloudwatch/alarms_history.pt (line 29)
- templates/cloudwatch/create_alarm_modal_template.pt (line 77)
- templates/cloudwatch/metricgraph.pt (line 176)
- templates/cloudwatch/metrics.pt (line 31)
- templates/panels/user_editor.pt (line 40)
fields.summary: i18n breaks due to invalid XHTML in various templates

comments.body:
This file was broken in a later commit:
templates/cloudwatch/create_alarm_modal_template.pt
I'll kick this back to the scrub for proper fix and verification. It seems like the i18n tooling is placing more demands on our templates than need to be there.
Looks good, but travis failed. Passing back, might pass to Adam after that's working?
Restarted Travis build, as it erred during npm install
[~alice]: This can be verified on a source install by running 'make translations' at the repo root.  Feel free to assign it to me to verify if necessary.

[~kgill] I tried source install on bothe centos 6 and centos 7. when I run "make translations in" eucaconsole repo root dir I get the below error

{code}
[root@euca-10-111-76-253 eucaconsole]# make translations
python setup.py extract_messages
/usr/lib64/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'message_extractors'
  warnings.warn(msg)
usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
   or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
   or: setup.py --help-commands
   or: setup.py cmd --help

error: invalid command 'extract_messages'
make: *** [translations] Error 1

{code}

[~alice]: Sorry, I forgot to mention 'make translations' requires Babel and Lingua, which can be installed via pip install -e .[i18n], as documented at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole#configuring-i18n

[~kgill] I installed Babel and Lingua on centos7, and still got the following error

Aborting due to parse error in /user-console-workspace/eucaconsole/eucaconsole/templates/cloudwatch/create_alarm_modal_template.pt: junk after document element: line 153, column 0
make: *** [translations] Error 1
